message: a very interesting article for getting started with Jenkins
story: Alaa Attya Mohamed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Setting Up Continuous Integration & Continuous Deployment With Jenkins - Tuts+ Code Tutorial
caption: code.tutsplus.com
description: Add a little automation to your life - let's set up a Jenkins instance to handle testing and deploying for us. | Difficulty: Beginner; Length: Medium; Tags: Web Development, Node.js, Web Server, Testing, SSH, Bash, Git, GitHub, DigitalOcean

data.message: i use it at work everyday, it is a our deployment here in here.
Emad Elsaid ana bsm3 bardo 3n travis grabto abl kda?!
I know that travis is being used by top frameworks such as Twitter Bootstrap. Travis is based on unit testing so you write your own tests and Travis run them and start the build if your tests pass.
Mohamed Alaa El Din yup i knew that wana bdawar, bs ana asln msh bkteb unit tests :D fa 3shan kda ro7t le Jenkins :D

hahahahahahaha, its a little bit hard to learn to write good unit tests but with practice and writing more unit tests it's actually more fun. a lot of people including my self (in the past) don't get the benefits of writing unit tests.

Since developers are terrible in writing documentation :D unit test is the alternative. it's actually your specs. 

I recommend you a very nice course in CodeSchool if you use ROR called https://www.codeschool.com/courses/rails-testing-for-zombies
